image.altText: A woman stands in front of microphones, with a man behind her looking at her.

props.synopsis: Many observers believed the Canberra Liberals leadership tussle was a two-way contest. But just like Scott Morrison in 2018, it was a third player who emerged victorious.

title.children: Like Scott Morrison in 2018, few saw this new opposition leader coming

image.altText: Leanne wears a blazer and dress, gesturing while speaking to media.

props.synopsis: Leanne Castley is elected leader of the Canberra Liberals, following the party's defeat at the ACT election.

title.children: Leanne Castley elected leader of the Canberra Liberals following election loss

image.altText: Damage from a fire in a prison common space.

props.synopsis: A man has been spared more jail time over his role in a 2020 riot at Canberra's jail, which started after prison staff refused to serve dessert or hand out cigarettes.

title.children: Man spared more jail time over Canberra prison riot which caused $1.6 million in damage

image.altText: ACT Supreme Court, Magistrates Court, building, generic

props.synopsis: The boy received a suspended sentence and good behaviour bond after a judge found he had demonstrated a degree of remorse.

title.children: Canberra school boy who raped 14-year-old girl avoids jail

image.altText: CCTV footage shows 'targeted' vandalism and theft at Canberra Hindu temple

props.synopsis: This is not the first time the buildings have been targeted by thieves and some community members say they are "horrified".

title.children: Two Hindu temples burgled, vandalised in broad daylight in Canberra

image.altText: A fishermen holds up a big octopus while standing on a boat

props.synopsis: Urs Buhlman set out to capture the rugged process commercial fishers go through to put food on our plates and found a proud industry with a future under threat.

title.children: Photographer captures the 'dangerous' work of commercial fishing rarely seen up close

image.altText: A man standing in a workshop holds a wooden box closed.

props.synopsis: After years of collecting beautiful pieces of timber, Australian woodworker Scott Mitchell couldn't believe it when he was asked to craft part of a gift for King Charles III.

title.children: Meet the Australian woodworker who crafted a box fit for a king

image.altText: Black gloves hold a pink vape in its packaging.

props.synopsis: Two Canberra men face the ACT Magistrates Court after they were arrested in a police sting targeting the trade in illegal vapes.

title.children: Two men facing charges after allegedly being caught with thousands of vapes and cash in Canberra

image.altText: A man wearing a chef's outfit stands behind a bar in front of many bottles of wine.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of Canberra restaurants are closing their doors, and the next 12 months is expected to get even worse.

title.children: Damien has already seen many colleagues close their restaurants, but says the next 12 months 'could be disastrous'

image.altText: A photo of a young women with long brown hair and blue eyes looking straight ahead with serious expression.

props.synopsis: Melanie Albert's vote in the US election won't have as much weight as people in some other states.

title.children: The US may be a democracy — but not every vote is created equal

image.altText: Illustration of 'tax magnet' pulling dollar coins from a 'big business' office block.

props.synopsis: The ATO's latest corporate tax transparency report reveals 31 per cent of companies did not pay a cent of tax. Here's the full list.

title.children: More than 1,200 large companies that paid no tax revealed, as ATO vows to fight profit shifting

image.altText: A man out of focus stands at a street intersection in a rural town where the road is covered in brown water.

props.synopsis: For the first time, demographers have calculated how many Australians move each year because of climate disasters such as fire, floods and cyclones. They say the figure is likely to be an underestimate.

title.children: Geoff was happy in Lismore until 'the big one'. Now he's one of thousands of climate relocators each year

image.altText: Cars are seen strewn across the median of a major highway leading to Valencia in Spain.

props.synopsis: The Spanish prime minister is urging residents to stay home as the country's weather bureau issues fresh weather alerts.

title.children: Death toll from Spanish flooding disaster jumps to 158 as further weather warnings are issued

image.altText: optus 'yes' sign on glass fronted office block

props.synopsis: Many of these consumers were living with a disability or were First Nations Australians from regional and remote areas.

title.children: Optus accused by ACCC of slugging vulnerable Australians out of thousands of dollars

image.altText: Close up on Jenni Brammall's hands holding an opalised shark tooth, Lightning Ridge, April 2024.

props.synopsis: In a fossil-rich pocket of northern New South Wales, two pioneering palaeontologists have spent decades digging up rare relics of the past, striking deals with collectors and opal miners, and unlocking our understanding of deep geological history.

title.children: This fossil collector may have just hit the jackpot. The only question is whether to sell or save it

image.altText: Elon Musk jumps onto an outdoor stage next to Donald Trump.

props.synopsis: Defence and communications analysts worry Australia's growing reliance on Starlink presents a security threat as Elon Musk could abruptly deny access "in a crisis".

title.children: Can Australians trust Elon Musk to keep Starlink switched on? Analysts think our new reliance is dangerous

image.altText: Protesters from the Freedom Convoy in Ottawa standing in front of police

props.synopsis: The report also found the more likely you are to believe in conspiracy theories, the more likely you are to accept extreme methods of protesting.

title.children: Criminal researchers say most Australians are alienated by violent protests

image.altText: A jogger runs along the shore of Manly Beach after sunrise on the first day of Spring in Sydney, 2008

props.synopsis: Australia's Pilbara region has been heating up, with temperatures soaring past 43C this week. The hot air is now starting to travel to the south-east, bringing along with it a heightened risk of fires.

title.children: A hot spell is travelling from west to east with most major cities expected to get 'warmest day in months'

image.altText: PMs courtyard, man talking, smiling

props.synopsis: You would have to be super optimistic to expect a revival in trust in the foreseeable future. But if it continues to fall away, the foundations of our political institutions and our society will become shakier.

title.children: Furore over Anthony Albanese's Qantas perks chips away at public trust in politicians

image.altText: An aerial shot of a big construction site, with cement trucks, utes, bollards, workers and portable office buildings.

props.synopsis: Builders in Ballarat say the lure of more work and money in Melbourne is taking away the vital workforce needed to meet the government's ambitious regional 2051 housing targets.

title.children: How mega projects in Melbourne could impact Victoria's regional housing growth

image.altText: A composite image showing two parents and two young people.

props.synopsis: Four years after Greg Ireland's daughter and Magda Pearce's son were murdered at a rural SA property, the two parents have picked up a torch for their children, and will be honouring their memories in this weekend's New York Marathon.

title.children: Their children were murdered, but Greg and Magda's emotional marathon has taken them to New York

image.altText: Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard gives a thumbs up as he and Ben Shelton leave the court after the Basel final.

props.synopsis: Giovanni Mpetshi Perricard stormed to the title at the Swiss Indoors in Basel, but his unique approach to serving could be a game-changer for tennis, according to one of the sport's best.

title.children: The young Frenchman who just might change the game of tennis for good

image.altText: A blue and yellow RACQ sign on a building.

props.synopsis: RACQ is under the microscope about whether its offers to renew home insurance for customers have properly compared new prices to previous year's premiums.

title.children: 'Deceptive and misleading': Regulator to examine RACQ pricing practice

image.altText: A woman holding a football on an oval

props.synopsis: Emma Kearney fulfilled a childhood dream when she became a footballer, but she says the AFLW still has a long way to go.

title.children: A heavier ball, longer rounds and more coaches: AFLW champion Emma Kearney calls for change

image.altText: Small bird hanging upside down in a tree.

props.synopsis: They are tiny, energetic and might be seen chasing their insect dinner in the forest canopy — that is, if you are extremely lucky enough to see one. There are fewer than 1,000 left in the wild.

title.children: This little bird could be 'gone, not with a bang, but a whimper', expert warns

image.altText: A woman in a black blazer holds her hands together

props.synopsis: Director-General Kerri Hartland told a select group of students that the agency was taking "gradual and considered steps to be "more open" about its mission.

title.children: Australia's overseas spy agency boss says her agents are facing 'intense' pressure due to advancing spy tech

image.altText: A man and woman stand in front of media microphones outside a primary school in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: Jack Davey's parents have thanked the community for their support, including the school receptionist who stayed with their son after he was fatally injured.

title.children: 'Our darkest hour': Melbourne parents who lost their son in horror collision thank the community for support

image.altText: A woman stares confidently at the camera with a marking of five strikes on her forehead symbolising an end to child marriage.

props.synopsis: The Taliban has extended restrictions on Afghan women's voices by banning them from praying aloud or reciting the Koran in front of other women.

title.children: New Taliban decree restricts Afghan women's voices in private spaces

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing pink hi-vis vest waves walking off plane next to Gina Rinehart

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton says his office did ask billionaire mining magnate Gina Rinehart "whether the plane might be available" to attend a memorial service, after the government did not provide a RAAF flight for him.

title.children: Peter Dutton says his office asked whether billionaire Gina Rinehart's jet was available for event

image.altText: man with face blurred holds paper in hands

props.synopsis: The incident occurred during a Student Representative Council meeting and comes just days after 27 students were expelled or suspended over a "serious humiliation" incident at one of the university's colleges.

title.children: University of Sydney to investigate after students filmed tearing up college sexual assault report

image.altText: Two men hunched over ground covered in concrete rubble alongside a yellow excavator

props.synopsis: The attack came hours after the Israeli military also renewed warnings for people in southern Lebanon to evacuate for their own safety.

title.children: Israel says it has launched strikes on Hezbollah facilities in Syria

image.altText: A mobile crane arm stretches toward an apartment building, with a section collapsed.

props.synopsis: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says the attack underscores the country's need for more military aid from its Western allies.

title.children: Two children among three dead in Russian air strike on Kharkiv, governor says

image.altText: Two women holding shopping bags and wearing colourful puffer jackets and face masks walk across a road.

props.synopsis: Researchers in the US have found that since the COVID pandemic, people are staying at home more than before. But in Australia, a study has found while feelings of isolation have increased, our sense of loneliness during the pandemic lockdowns didn't.

title.children: Staying home has become the 'new normal' since COVID peak, study shows

image.altText: Two faceless people wearing clothes, with one saying AUSTRALIAN FEDERAL POLICE and the other saying NDIS

props.synopsis: Three people have been sentenced to multiple years imprisonment by a Sydney Central District Court over their roles in a scheme that defrauded millions from the NDIS and ATO.

title.children: Three people sentenced over roles in $5.8m fraud against NDIS and ATO, ordered to pay back over $575k

image.altText: Georgia Garnett of the Giants completes a hand pass as a defender begins to tackle her

props.synopsis: Georgia Garnett struggled at university while her mates managed to remain focused while studying. Her ADHD not only helped her understand her brain, but allowed her to excel in the AFLW.

title.children: How AFLW star Georgia Garnett learnt her ADHD was a weapon on the field
